line.text:

Following an earlier incident at 72 St, [2] and [3] train service has resumed with residual delays.

[SB] buses run between 135 St and 148 St, stopping at 145 St.

line.name: ACE
line.text:
Delays  Posted: 07/23/2015 12:03AM

Due to a rail condition at 14 St, northbound [A] and [E] trains are running with delays.

Allow additional travel time.



Planned Work

Late Nights, 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Jul 20 - 24

For service to these stations, take the [E] to Roosevelt Av and
transfer to a Jamaica Center-bound [E] local.

For service from these stations, take the [E] to 71 Av and
transfer to a World Trade Center-bound [E].




Planned Work

[SB] Free shuttle buses provide alternate service
Late Nights, 11:30 PM to 5 AM, Mon to Fri, Jul 20 - 24

[A] service operates in two sections:
1. Between 207 St and Jay St-MetroTech
2. Between Utica Av and Lefferts Blvd/Mott Av

Travel Alternatives[TP]

[SB] buses make all stops between Jay St-MetroTech and Utica Av.
• Transfer between [A] trains and [SB] buses at Jay St-MetroTech and/or Utica Av.

For service between Manhattan and Brooklyn, take the [J] or [L].
• Transfer between [A] and [J] trains at Fulton St and/or Broadway Junction.
• Transfer between [A] and [L] trains at 14 St/8 Av and/or Broadway Junction.

line.name: BDFM
line.text:

Allow additional travel time.

Allow additional travel time.

For service to these stations, take the [F] to W 4 St and transfer
to a Jamaica-bound [F].

For service from these stations, take the [F] to 34 St-Herald Sq
and transfer to a Coney Island-bound [F].

For service to DeKalb Av, take the [D] to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and transfer to a
Manhattan-bound [D] [N] or [Q].

For service from this station, take the [Q] to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and transfer to the [D].

For service from these stations, take the [D] or [N] to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and

transfer to a Norwood-bound [D].

For service from these stations, take the [D] to Tremont Av or Fordham Rd and

line.name: NQR
line.text:
Planned Work
[Q] Coney Island-bound trains run via the [R] from Canal St to DeKalb Av

Late Nights, 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Wed to Fri, Jul 22 - 24

Trains stop at City Hall, Cortlandt, Rector, Whitehall, Court Sts and Jay St-MetroTech.

• Please allow additional travel time.




Planned Work
[N] Coney Island-bound trains run express from Canal St to 36 St via the Manhattan Bridge

Late Nights, 11:45 PM to 5 AM, Wed to Fri, Jul 22 - 24

Trains stop at Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr.

For City Hall, Cortlandt, Rector, Whitehall, Court Sts, Jay St-MetroTech and
DeKalb Av, take the [Q]*.

• Transfer between [N] and [Q] trains at Canal St or Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr.

For service to Union St, 4 Av-9 St, Prospect Av and 25 St, take the [N] to 36 St and
transfer to a Manhattan-bound [D] or [N].

For service from these stations, take the [D] or [N] to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and
transfer to a Coney Island-bound [N].

*This detour has taken into account additional planned service changes.

Alternate travel note:
For service to Court St, Jay St-MetroTech and DeKalb Av, take the [N] to Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr and transfer to an Astoria-bound [N].

your trip. If you are deaf or hard of hearing, use your preferred relay service provider or the free 711 relay.

line.name: Waterbury
line.text:
Service Change  Posted: 06/04/2015 11:57AM

To accommodate the final phase of a $5.8 million priority-repair project on Devon Bridge, a new, temporary transfer point --Devon Transfer--has been built where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet. Track 3, also known as the inbound local track, will be out of service continuously for six months while the work occurs. As a result, starting Monday, May 4th: All Waterbury Branch customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at the new Devon Transfer location, cross the walkway, and wait for a train on Track 1, also known as the inbound express track. Waterbury Branch customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train connection to New Haven. Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at the Devon Transfer and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See more details at http://bit.ly/1a5iYhwÂ
